shortDescription: Internet Explorer 5.01 SP4 up to 6 on various Windows operating systems, including IE 6.0.2900.2180 on Windows XP, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a web page with embedded CLSIDs that reference certain COM objects that are not ActiveX controls, as demonstrated using the JVIEW Profiler (Javaprxy.dll).  NOTE: the researcher says that the vendor could not reproduce this problem.
vulnerabilityName: Microsoft IE 5.01 SP4 up to 6 javaprxy.dll COM Instantiation Heap Corruption Vulnerability
required_action: Apply remediations or mitigations per vendor instructions or discontinue use of the product if remediation or mitigations are unavailable.
